greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n as a sum of 2 semiprimes.
comment: The graph of this sequence is compelling evidence that 33 is the last term of sequence A072966. - _T. D. Noe_, Apr 10 2007
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
formula: a(n) = Sum_{i=1..floor(n/2)} [Omega(i) == 2] * [Omega(n-i) == 2], where Omega = A001222 and [] is the Iverson Bracket. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Apr 04 2018
mathematica: c = Tally[ Sort[ Map[ Total, Union[Subsets[s, {2}],
program: (PARI) a(n)=sum(i=1, n, sum(j=1, i, if(abs(bigomega(i)-2) + abs(bigomega(j)-2) + abs(n-i-j),0,1)))
(PARI) a(n)=my(s); forprime(p=2,n\4, forprime(q=2,min(n\(2*p),p), if(bigomega(n-p*q)==2, s++))); s \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 07 2014
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Aug 13 2002
